task-wr.title: Installing the First Controller
task-wr.shortdesc: The first step in installing Titanium Server is to install and configure the first controller.

context.p: For an overview of methods, see .

note.p: For the configuration to run successfully, the management interface on controller-0 must be connected and operational.

step.cmd: US62850 mention PXE boot server:Using an ISO image of the Titanium Server software from an external source, such as a USB flash drive or a DVD, or a PXE boot server, initialize the controller host.

info.p: Initialization installs an operating system on the host's disk drive, and automatically boots the host from the drive.

step.cmd: Copy the installation files and any other required files to controller-0.
Apply any required software patches to controller-0.
US62804 mention controller configuration input file:Configure the host as a controller using the config_controller command-line script.

info.p: You can respond to the script interactively, or you can prepare and use a controller configuration input file. For more information, see .

postreq.p: Use controller-0 to initialize and configure the second controller/compute node.
Use controller-0 to initialize and configure the remaining hosts (the second controller node, the storage nodes, and the compute nodes).
